content.body: Short notes from today's meeting, we discussed my proposal for matchers-everywhere https://hackmd.io/ubn93HPNT2GCjFwNOPzWCA
> Somewhat against the extractor syntax, partially due to Scala experience.
content.formatted_body: Somewhat against the extractor syntax, partially due to Scala experience.

content.body: any info of why scala experience is bad?

i'll flesh out the notes again. but mainly that scala is a mess of syntax that means tons of things in different contexts, and it's very unintuitive to me that you can kind of use constructors as extractors
either way it's more that `foo()` syntax imo shouldn't mean anything except invocation, and `foo{}` is just weird
content.formatted_body: either way it's more that foo() syntax imo shouldn't mean anything except invocation, and foo{} is just weird
